summary: The Great Lakes Restoration Initiative Act of 2025 (H.R. 284) is a bipartisan bill that reauthorizes funding for the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative. It amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to authorize $500,000,000 for each of the fiscal years 2027 through 2031. This funding is dedicated to protecting and restoring the Great Lakes ecosystem, addressing issues like pollution and habitat degradation. The bill ensures the continuation of this major environmental program, highlighting a collaborative effort among numerous representatives to preserve this critical natural resource.
